intro: Porolabium, commonly known as the swamp hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Malvaceae family. These plants are characterized by their showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to red. They are native to tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia and the Pacific Islands. Porolabium species often thrive in wet, swampy environments, showcasing their adaptability to waterlogged soils. Their leaves are usually broad and heart-shaped, contributing to their distinctive appearance.
